Cry aloud, spare not, lift up thy voice like a trumpet, and shew my people their transgression, and the house of Jacob their sins.<RF>aloud: Heb. with the throat<Rf>

Yet they seek me daily, and delight to know my ways, as a nation that did righteousness, and forsook not the ordinance of their God: they ask of me the ordinances of justice; they take delight in approaching to God.<CM>

Wherefore have we fasted, <FI>say they<Fi>, and thou seest not? <FI>wherefore<Fi> have we afflicted our soul, and thou takest no knowledge? Behold, in the day of your fast ye find pleasure, and exact all your labours.<RF>labours: or, things wherewith ye grieve others: Heb. griefs<Rf>

Behold, ye fast for strife and debate, and to smite with the fist of wickedness: ye shall not fast as <FI>ye do this<Fi> day, to make your voice to be heard on high.<RF>ye shall…: or, ye fast not as this day<Rf>

Is it such a fast that I have chosen? a day for a man to afflict his soul? <FI>is it<Fi> to bow down his head as a bulrush, and to spread sackcloth and ashes <FI>under him<Fi>? wilt thou call this a fast, and an acceptable day to the LORD?<RF>a day…: or, to afflict his soul for a day?<Rf>

<FI>Is<Fi> not this the fast that I have chosen? to loose the bands of wickedness, to undo the heavy burdens, and to let the oppressed go free, and that ye break every yoke?<RF>the heavy…: Heb. the bundles of the yoke<Rf><RF>oppressed: Heb. broken<Rf>

<FI>Is it<Fi> not to deal thy bread to the hungry, and that thou bring the poor that are cast out to thy house? when thou seest the naked, that thou cover him; and that thou hide not thyself from thine own flesh?<RF>cast…: or, afflicted<Rf><CM>

Then shall thy light break forth as the morning, and thine health shall spring forth speedily: and thy righteousness shall go before thee; the glory of the LORD shall be thy rereward.<RF>be…: Heb. gather thee up<Rf>

Then shalt thou call, and the LORD shall answer; thou shalt cry, and he shall say, Here I <FI>am<Fi>. If thou take away from the midst of thee the yoke, the putting forth of the finger, and speaking vanity;
And <FI>if<Fi> thou draw out thy soul to the hungry, and satisfy the afflicted soul; then shall thy light rise in obscurity, and thy darkness <FI>be<Fi> as the noonday:

And the LORD shall guide thee continually, and satisfy thy soul in drought, and make fat thy bones: and thou shalt be like a watered garden, and like a spring of water, whose waters fail not.<RF>drought: Heb. droughts<Rf><RF>fail: Heb. lie, or, deceive<Rf>

And <FI>they that shall be<Fi> of thee shall build the old waste places: thou shalt raise up the foundations of many generations; and thou shalt be called, The repairer of the breach, The restorer of paths to dwell in.<CM>

If thou turn away thy foot from the sabbath, <FI>from<Fi> doing thy pleasure on my holy day; and call the sabbath a delight, the holy of the LORD, honourable; and shalt honour him, not doing thine own ways, nor finding thine own pleasure, nor speaking <FI>thine own<Fi> words:

Then shalt thou delight thyself in the LORD; and I will cause thee to ride upon the high places of the earth, and feed thee with the heritage of Jacob thy father: for the mouth of the LORD hath spoken <FI>it<Fi>.<CM>
